segments.text: I'm noticing how many little things are adding up to a bigger problem here.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The running faucet, unchecked, is creating a real flood.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The woman’s foot is already soaked, but she doesn't flinch.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Then there’s the wobbly stool, threatening to send the boy tumbling.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The open cookie jar is the bait, drawing the children into this risky scenario.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It’s a cascade of minor oversights and small acts of mischief.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Each element alone might not be a huge issue, but together, it’s a setup for disaster.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can just imagine the crash of dishes if the boy falls onto that wet floor.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The silence of the scene, broken only by the sound of rushing water, is eerie.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I feel a growing sense of unease watching it all unfold.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It truly is a precarious balance between routine and impending accident.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: This whole scene makes me want to shout a warning to someone.
segments.speaker: PAR
